question: Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enrol in the course
text: I am writing to apply for a new computer course starting at college next month. I am currently doing my third-year graduation in the economics department. I have a keen interest in learning computer courses which will be beneficial to my future.

Moreover, I am from a middle-class family, who cannot afford the course fee mentioned in private classes outside the college. In order to this joining the new course beginning in our college will be excellent support for me.

Additionally, I am sorry to inform you that I do not have any elementary knowledge to enrol on the new batch. I am requesting your help to find a way to join the class and it would be appreciatable by sharing the class timings.
I am attaching my academic records with this request. Furthermore, if you require to know anything please do not hesitate to contact to my mobile number +91 6548464247.

error_list.error_des: The noun phrase excellent support seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
